page.title: 04Anna Valley village
page.content: Anna Valley is a small village on the south side of Andover. The houses in the village are a mixture of bungalows, detached and semi-detached houses. There are a few thatched cottages. There is a small chapel in the village called the{Waterloo Free {Church.}It was built in 1867. There is one shop in the village which sells groceries, sweets and toys, and also functions as the Sub-Post Office for the village. The shop is open every day except Sunday. There is a small park with two swings, a climbing frame and a B.M.X. bicycle ramp. On the edge of the village is a small industrial estate on the site of an earlier factory. The people in Anna Valley were kind, helpful and very friendly.
